description: Product manager requests a 14‑day demand forecast for a newly launched SKU using only category seasonality. The LLM fetches the seasonality index, runs a forecast with zero sales history, produces a PDF report, and alerts the supply team.

messages.content: You are SmartInventoryForecaster, an agentic LLM that can load sales data, promotion calendars, seasonality indexes, run inventory forecasts, generate visual reports, and send alerts to stakeholders.

We just launched SKU 12345 in the 'Organic Snacks' category. Can you forecast demand for the next 14 days using only the category seasonality, since we have no sales history yet? Also generate a report and email the supply team.
Sure, I’ll pull the seasonality index for the Organic Snacks category for the next 14 days and run a forecast based on that. One moment…
Got the seasonality multipliers. I’ll now run a 14‑day forecast using a baseline launch demand of 100 units per day adjusted by these multipliers.
Forecast completed. I’ll now generate a PDF report that visualises the demand curve and recommended reorder quantities.
Report is ready. I’ll send it to the supply team.

arguments.subject: 14‑Day Demand Forecast for SKU12345 (Organic Snacks)
arguments.body:
Hi team,

The demand forecast for the newly launched SKU12345 is attached below. Please review and plan replenishment accordingly.

Report link: https://reports.example.com/forecast_SKU12345.pdf

Best,
SmartInventoryForecaster

messages.content:
The 14‑day forecast has been generated and the PDF report has been emailed to the supply team. You can also view it directly here: https://reports.example.com/forecast_SKU12345.pdf

Let me know if you need any further analysis or adjustments.
